page.title: 06THE PEOPLE OF BRANCEPETH
page.content: Despite the development of 3 small exclusive housing estates, most people do not think the village has lost its "olde" world charm.They all liked the peacefulness and without exception were sad the cricket field had gone.There are no shops and some people would like one for convenience foods.There is a post office in the gatehouse of the castle which sells sweets, eggs and potatoes. Most shop in Durham and travel by car.Their favourite part of Brancepeth was the churchyard and the castle grounds.One man was upset at recent developments saying that it had killed the village atmosphere.The castle houses students from Durhan University who liked the idea of living in a castle.They get on well together but they thought the villagers very "snooty".
